title: Harvey Weinstein found guilty in second sex crimes trial
description: The 70-year-old is already serving 23 years in jail after he was convicted in New York two years ago.

title: Panel calls for Trump to face insurrection charge
description: The committee airs critical testimony by a Trump loyalist and criticises his daughter, Ivanka Trump.

title: Ukraine to boost Belarus border defences as Putin meets Lukashenko
description: Kyiv fears a fresh Russian assault is on the horizon after President Putin travelled to Minsk.

title: Venezuelans ignore dangers of Darién jungle
description: A record number of people attempt the trek this year on foot in search of a better life in the US.

title: In pictures: France receive heroes' welcome in Paris after World Cup heartbreak
description: The French national team are met by thousands in Paris after losing to Argentina on Sunday.

title: At Hanukkah event Biden slams 'venom' of antisemitism
description: At the Jewish festival of lights, Mr Biden took a moment to slam a "venom" of hatred on the rise globally.

title: Amber Heard settles defamation case against Johnny Depp
description: Ms Heard will pay her ex-husband $1m after jury found she had defamed him in a Washington Post article.

title: British Airways: Flights leaving US grounded over technical issue
description: British Airways apologises to passengers left waiting in airports and on runways across the US.

title: Elon Musk: Twitter users vote in favour of boss resigning
description: Some 57.5% of users voted "yes" when Elon Musk asked them if he should quit as Twitter's chief executive.

title: Vaughan condo shooting: Three victims were on condo board
description: Police said the gunman, who lived in the building, killed five people in three separate units.

title: Chaos as severe turbulence hits Hawaiian Airlines plane
description: At least 36 people were injured, 11 seriously, during the passenger jet's flight to Honolulu.

title: EU nations agree gas price cap to shield consumers
description: The cap will kick in if prices breach 180 euros per megawatt hour for three days running.

title: Fortnite settles child privacy and trickery claims
description: Epic Games pays $520m over claims it violated child privacy laws and tricked players into making purchases.

title: Ethiopia civil war: The boy named ‘Wealthy’ who weighs half what he should
description: Ethiopia's civil war has left tens of thousands, including large numbers of children, malnourished.

title: Poachers target hippos for giant teeth in place of ivory
description: As bans on elephant ivory are tightened, poachers are killing hippos for their teeth, experts warn.

title: ‘We long for Ukraine - but our son has chances here’
description: For some disabled refugees, fleeing Ukraine has given a better quality of life, provoking a dilemma.

title: The cargo hauling aircraft with no pilots on board
description: Rejecting deliveries to the doorstep, some drone makers are betting on bigger pilot-free aircraft.

title: Explaining the criminal charges January 6 committee recommended for Trump
description: The 6 January committee says there's enough evidence to prosecute the former president on four charges.

title: Thailand warship capsizes during storm
description: Video from the Thai Navy shows the ship on its side, as it is about to capsize.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Argentina really needed this win'
description: Victory in the 2022 World Cup has bought relief to many in a country facing continuing economic problems.

title: German cathedral school allows girl choristers after 1,000 years
description: In Germany, the Regensburg cathedral school has founded a separate girls choir.

title: Ukrainians install Christmas 'tree of invincibility'
description: The tree in Mykolaiv is made from camouflage nets which will be donated to soldiers in the new year.

title: Peru-Bolivia border blocked by protesters
description: Demonstrators have prevented travellers crossing a border between Peru and Bolivia, after protesting for early elections.

title: Ukraine missile struck as mum sat with child to do homework
description: Several people die after an attack on a residential building in the central Ukrainian city of Kryvyi Rih.

title: Biden condemns antisemitism at White House Hanukkah event
description: US President Joe Biden said he will not remain silent as long as antisemitism in the US is on the rise. He made the comments durng a Hanukkah event at the White House.

title: Harvey Weinstein found guilty of rape in Los Angeles
description: The former movie mogul faced four allegations of rape and sexual misconduct in California after his conviction in New York. He could be sentenced to an additional 18-24 years in prison.

title: Bahamas: FTX's Bankman-Fried agrees to US extradition
description: US prosecutors allege he played a key role in the collapse of FTX — a cryptocurrency exchange and crypto hedge fund he founded — and hid its problems from investors.

title: Trial of Proud Boys charged with seditious conspiracy starts
description: A judge began questioning potential jurors in the seditious conspiracy case against former leaders of the Proud Boys charged in the attack on the US Capitol.

title: US to investigate Hawaiian airlines flight after turbulence seriously injures passengers
description: Dozens of people were badly hurt during the flight, with 11 in serious condition. The investigation will probe what the crew was doing at the time of the turbulence as well as look at the flight data recorder.

title: Opinion: Elon Musk's ridiculous Twitter poll
description: Since the egomaniacal billionaire took over Twitter, the platform has fallen into complete disarray. Now, Elon Musk has put himself up for a vote. But Martin Muno believes it's all just for show.

title: Menorah from iconic photo returns to Germany for Hanukkah
description: A Hanukkah menorah at the center of the most searing images of the Nazis' rise was lit in the German capital 90 years after the family who owned it fled the looming Holocaust.

title: US Jan. 6 committee recommends Trump be criminally charged
description: The bipartisan committee urged the Justice Department to prosecute Donald Trump for his part in the deadly riot. It is the first time in US history that Congress has recommended charges against a former president.

title: Qatar World Cup: Air traffic spike casts doubt on carbon neutrality claim
description: Host nation Qatar claimed it would be staging a carbon-neutral football World Cup. However, the emirate's eco-measures were dwarfed by a significant increase in air traffic during the tournament.

title: US Vice President Kamala Harris: How is she doing?
description: Kamala Harris is the first female vice president in US history. She is now two years into her term in a job that has been far from easy. But is the VP doing what is necessary to fulfill her role?

title: EU agrees to gas price cap
description: After months of negotiation, the EU reached an agreement on a gas price cap at 180€ per megawatt hour. However, concerns remained about its impact on gas supplies.

title: RECOMMENDED — World strikes "the largest agreement to protect land and sea in history" at COP15
description: Global leaders have agreed to protect and restore a third of the Earth's natural areas, and eliminate or redirect $500 billion from environmentally harmful subsidies to fund the deal.

title: 'Fortnite' creator to pay $520 million to settle complaints
description: Epic Games is accused of collecting children's information and deceptive billing in the popular videogame. US regulators have also said that the games voice chat options must be turned off for younger children.

title: Former African leaders' mediation efforts under scrutiny
description: Former African heads of state play a significant role in mediating conflicts across Africa. However, some lack an understanding of the complexities and don't have language skills, which dents their mediation efforts.

title: EU accuses Facebook parent Meta of distorting ads market
description: The EU's competition watchdog has accused tech giant Meta, which owns Facebook and Instagram, of breaching antitrust rules. An early analysis says the firm distorted competition in the online classified ads business.

title: Iranian footballer reportedly facing execution
description: The Islamic Republic of Iran is reported to be planning to execute professional footballer Amir Nasr-Azadani. Former Wolfsburg and Hertha Berlin player Ashkan Dejagah has been barred from leaving the country.

title: Helene Cixous: Iranian women and 'the desire for freedom'
description: French feminist and author Helene Cixous speaks to DW about the courage shown by women protesting in Iran and what the movement means for the country.

title: Argentina's emotional rollercoaster to roll on — at a more leisurely pace
description: Since Argentina clinched their third World Cup, Buenos Aires has been setting new standards in celebrations. As Argentines enjoy a historic moment, the question of what comes next has been set aside — for now.

title: EU reacts to Indonesia's law banning sex outside marriage
description: Indonesia recently passed a law that drew criticism for criminalizing premarital and extramarital sex, among other things. It also mandates punishments for "insulting" the president.

title: Weather forecasting: Will it rain today? No one really knows
description: The English say so much depends on the weather, from battles in war to aid work. But our predictions are seldom perfect.

title: Netherlands apologizes for role in historic slave trade
description: Prime Minister Mark Rutte apologized for Netherlands' slavery past. Some affected nations and groups have criticized the move.

title: World Cup: Kingsley Coman and the abyss of social media
description: After Kingsley Coman missed a penalty in the World Cup final shootout, Twitter and Instagram were flooded with racist messages directed at the French national team player. The pattern is all too familiar.

title: Puma tanks unusable: Is Germany's military unfit for action?
description: Following Russia's attack on Ukraine, German leaders vowed to boost the Bundeswehr and take on a leading role in NATO. But now there is yet another debacle: All of the cutting-edge Puma tanks are unfit for action.

title: Swedish court stops extradition of Turkish journalist
description: The Swedish Supreme Court has blocked the extradition to Turkey of an exiled journalist. President Erdogan had demanded the return of Bulent Kenes as a condition of Sweden's NATO membership.

title: UK court rules Rwanda deportations plan lawful
description: London's High Court said Britain's plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda is legal. A planned deportation flight in June was blocked by the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR).

title: Germany: Black ice unleashes road, rail and air travel woes
description: Black ice has wreaked transport misery across Germany, with weather warnings, flight cancellations, and at least one fatality. Forecasters have warned the conditions could further disrupt road and railway traffic.

title: Travel trend: Hitting the road solo gains in popularity
description: Traveling alone is increasingly common in Germany and Europe. From clubbing holidays to rooming with strangers, tour operators are adapting to the trend.

title: What makes 'Avatar: The Way of Water' so special?
description: It took 13 years: Now the sequel to the most successful film of all time is finally hitting theaters. Will James Cameron achieve the blockbuster hit he's hoping for?

title: COP15: UN conference reaches historic biodiversity deal
description: Negotiators have signed off on a deal to protect 30% of land and water considered important for biodiversity by 2030. The agreement aims to stave off the possible extinction of thousands of animal and plant species.

title: Ukraine updates: Kyiv takes fire from drone attacks
description: Kyiv has reported another night of air alarms and said it has shot down several drones. The UK is set to announce plans to sending munitions through 2023. DW has the latest.

title: Russian clowns 'unlikely' to help troop morale in Ukraine
description: Efforts to send Russian circus performers and opera singers to the frontlines are unlikely to improve "fragile morale," the UK has said. Meanwhile, heating has been restored to frigid Kyiv. DW has the latest.

title: Messi: 'I want to live a few more games as world champion'
description: Lionel Messi admitted there is nothing else he can do in an Argentina shirt to eclipse what he has achieved in Qatar. But Argentina's World Cup hero hinted that he may yet prolong his international career.

title: Opinion: Spectacular World Cup final showed football will never belong to FIFA
description: By handing the World Cup to Qatar to instrumentalize for geopolitical gain, FIFA sold football out. But Lionel Messi and Argentina showed that the beautiful game will always win, writes DW's Matt Ford.

title: Opinion: France is multicultural — get over it
description: The French national team is seen as an African team to many around the world, due to its multicultural nature. It's unfair on the players, on French football and most of all, French society, write's DW's Ali Farhat.

title: Argentina fans celebrate World Cup victory over France
description: Hundreds of thousands of fans were seen celebrating in Buenos Aires after Argentina won the World Cup for the third time. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron tweeted that "Les Bleus made us dream."

title: Opinion: World Cup triumph means Messi is now the best
description: The Argentina star deserves to be classed as the greatest male footballer of all time, not just for his trophies but for the way he plays the game, writes DW's Mark Meadows in Qatar.

title: World Cup: Messi leads Argentina to victory over France
description: Argentina have won the World Cup for the third time after beating France on penalties in Doha. Lionel Messi scored twice as he finally got his hands on football's most coveted prize, cementing his legendary status.

title: German union Verdi urges Amazon strikes ahead of Christmas
description: The Verdi union announced work stoppages at seven distribution centers, but did not specify when they will be held. "Colleagues are furious and don't want to be taken for fools," the union said.

title: Italian police arrest four over Milan New Year's assaults
description: Police in Italy pieced together online evidence and smartphone footage before detaining four Egyptian nationals. Two of the women attacked in Milan were German tourists.

title: Bosnians flee corruption and hopelessness
description: Criminal networks and poor prospects have sparked a mass exodus from Bosnia. Many feel abandoned by the international community.

title: Ukraine selects Eurovision 2023 song from bomb shelter
description: Ukraine has selected its official entry for the 2023 Eurovision Song Contest as artists gathered in a makeshift bomb shelter in Kyiv.

title: Germany's small hospitals are disappearing
description: One small hospital closes every month in Germany. Politicians say there are too many, and the health care system can't afford to keep them all open. But their critics say patients may die due to closures.

title: 'Tis the season for the ugly Christmas sweater
description: From the US to the UK and even Germany — it's time again to dig out and actually wear that ugly Christmas sweater. Yes, the gaudy one with Santa, elves and real jingle bells. Here are some of our favorites.

title: Dutch slavery apology won't be enough, descendants say
description: The government in the Netherlands, one of the last European nations to abolish slavery, is set to make a historic apology. But some on the receiving end say they've not been consulted.

title: Eight candles and a helper: Hanukkah
description: Starting on December 18, Jews will celebrate the eight-day festival of Hanukkah, commemorating the rededication of Jerusalem's Second Temple in 200 BC.

title: Technical problems plague Germany's Puma armored vehicles
description: The German-built infantry fighting vehicles were reportedly plagued by defects during a recent training exercise. The incidents have jeopardized the vehicle's use in NATO's spearhead force next year.

title: Iran arrests famous actress Taraneh Alidoosti over protests
description: The actress, who starred in the Oscar-winning film "The Salesman," had made a post expressing solidarity with an executed protester. Pro-government media said she was accused of "spreading false information."

title: Moldova suspends six channels over Ukraine 'disinformation'
description: Moldovan authorities said that the channels' licenses were revoked in order to prevent "disinformation" about Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Pope honors Poles killed for hiding Jews during World War II
description: Jozef and Wiktoria Ulma offered several Jewish people refuge from the Nazis in German-occupied Poland before being caught and killed. The Vatican now plans to beatify the pair before possible sainthood.

title: Polish police headquarters explosion caused by Ukraine gift
description: Police chief Jaroslaw Szymczyk said that Ukrainian authorities had assured him that the gift was "used and safe." Polish authorities are probing the incident and considering whether to bring charges.

title: Leo Varadkar elected Irish prime minister for second time
description: When two major political parties came together after Ireland's election in 2020, they agreed to share the role of taoiseach, or prime minister. After two-and-a-half years, Micheal Martin steps down and Varadkar returns.

title: World Cup 2022: Croatia beat Morocco in unusually entertaining third-place clash
description: Luka Modric and his teammates add another honor to their runners-up finish in 2018, finishing third at the World Cup in Qatar. Morocco come up short but their fans remain proud after a dazzling run.

title: Opinion: Germany's shortage of kids' medicine was avoidable
description: Europe's largest economy is short on basic medicines, like paracetamol and ibuprofen, for children and babies. It might be shocking but it's no surprise, writes DW's Kristie Pladson.

title: Is Germany attractive enough for qualified workers?
description: Germany is urgently seeking workers from abroad — at least 400,000 each year. But is it an attractive destination for highly qualified foreigners? For some, it seems, having to learn the German language puts them off.

title: German police find loot stolen from Dresden museum
description: The loot, stolen from Dresden's Green Vault in 2019, had a total value of more than €113 million. Stolen items included some 4,300 diamonds and gemstones from the 17th and 18th centuries.

title: Germany: Scholz opens country's first LNG terminal
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz and other ministers praised the project as showing the new "speed" of Europe's biggest economy. But the floating terminal's high-profile opening was sharply criticized by environmental groups.

title: Berlin aquarium disaster: Hundreds of fish rescued
description: An estimated 1,500 saltwater fish were living in the AquaDom aquarium at the Radisson Blu hotel complex in Berlin when it burst.

title: World Cup 2022: How traveling fans gave the World Cup its soul
description: The controversial Qatar World Cup was a unique spectacle that divided opinion in the West. But Asian, Arab and Latin American fans gave the tournament the soul it sorely lacked.

title: Wiretapping scandal in Greece
description: The list of people suspected of having been spied on by the state keeps getting longer. Yet there has been no public outcry. The scandal may not impact much on the 2023 parliamentary elections.

title: German hospitals warn of medication shortages
description: Amid shortages of medications in German pharmacies, the country's hospital federation says healthcare facilities are also affected. Politicians are mulling ramping up domestic production, even if it costs more.

title: Germany strikes against child sex abuse 'darknet' forums
description: German investigators have closed three Internet forums on the "darknet" with depictions of the sexual abuse of children. Four suspects were arrested.

title: Snakes have 2 clitorises, but do they have sex for pleasure?
description: A new study found that female snakes have a pair of clitorises that's not dissimilar to the organ in humans. Female genitalia in animals is an under-researched area, the study's lead author says.

title: Opinion: The World Cup in Qatar has deepened divisions
description: Some claim that sports and politics are entirely separate issues. The World Cup in Qatar proved just the opposite — and deepened rifts between the West and the Arab world, writes DW's Pascal Jochem.

title: Slovakia: Uncertainty ahead after government ousted
description: Slovakia's parliament voted to topple the country's self-proclaimed anti-corruption, reformist government yesterday after two-and-a-half years in office. What happens next and how did it come to this?

title: Pope orders return of parts of the Parthenon to Greece
description: After more than 200 years at the Vatican Museum, fragments of Athens' Parthenon temple may soon return home to Greece.

title: 'It is heaven-sent:' Expanded 2026 World Cup offers more chances but more confusion
description: The US, Mexico and Canada are to host the next edition with 48 teams, despite FIFA's vow to never again have joint hosts. Although the format has still not been agreed upon, allocation of continental slots is settled.

title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Ukrainian people win Charlemagne Prize
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and the Ukrainian people will win the 2023 Charlemagne Prize, the body awarding the prize in Aachen has said. The prize honors work done in the service of European unification.

title: To cut off Russian gas, EU burns billions on LNG
description: The European Union is investing billions in infrastructure in its effort to replace Russian fuels with liquefied natural gas. This could prove to be a dead end — both for taxpayers and for the climate.

title: UK: 'Warm banks' emerge in Britain as temperatures plummet
description: Warm banks, where people can sit and access free heating, have sprung up across Britain amid a cost-of-living crisis. Meanwhile, London pubs are opening their doors to remote workers as they battle for survival.

title: Gianni Infantino lauds 'best World Cup ever' as Morocco lands Club World Cup
description: Gianni Infantino has described Qatar 2022 as "the best World Cup ever" confirming record revenues for FIFA. The organization's president also announced plans to expand the Club World Cup to 32 teams from 2025.

title: The world's most expensive Harry Potter books at auction
description: A very rare edition of "The Philosopher's Stone" won by a competition winner sold for £8,000 at auction following a year of record sales for first edition copies.

title: Agriculture is a nature killer — what can we do about it?
description: The farming system that feeds the world is the biggest killer of biodiversity. It does so by destroying habitats, overusing fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides, and creating vast monocultures. But there are solutions.

title: Benin Bronzes: From German museums off to Nigeria
description: Restitution begins: Many valuable cultural objects that once belonged to the kingdom of Benin and have been housed and displayed in German museums for more than 100 years will be on their way back to Nigeria.

title: World Cup: Can France or Argentina reap economic dividends?
description: The World Cup final takes place on Sunday. For the hosts Qatar, much has already been said about the tournament's economic legacy. But what about the winners?

title: How bad for the environment is traveling?
description: Travel allows us to explore other cultures, but it's also harmful for the environment. Can changing your mode of transportation make a difference?

title: Berlin: Massive aquarium home to 1,500 fish bursts
description: More than 100 firefighters were called to the scene at the Radisson Blu complex in the German capital's Mitte district. The 16-meter aquarium houses 1,500 tropical fish. Two people have so far been reported injured.

title: Miedema injured as Lyon show their steely side
description: Lyon eked out a critical 1-0 away win that keeps alive their hopes of a seventh Champions League title in eight seasons. But their narrow victory over Arsenal was marred by yet another injury to a top player.

title: Cologne hands over stolen Benin Bronzes to Nigeria
description: Another major German city has begun giving back artwork stolen by British colonialists in the 19th century. Germany holds more than 1,000 pieces of the Benin Bronzes.

title: Opinion: 'Harry & Meghan': Let's not get carried away
description: The whole fuss surrounding the Netflix documentary about Harry and Meghan is fueled by the media. And beyond the royal family feud, the tabloid press is at the core of the problem, says DW's Silke Wünsch.

title: Ukrainian refugee kids face a challenge in German schools
description: How refugee children are educated in Germany depends on where they live. And that can have far-reaching consequences.

title: World Cup 2022: Even if Benzema makes shock return, Antoine Griezmann is France's real star
description: The forward-turned-midfielder has been one of the stand-out performers at the Qatar World Cup. Griezmann's positioning is unique and could be a key factor in the World Cup Final with Argentina.

title: ECB raises eurozone interest rate by 0.5%
description: The European Central Bank has raised its main interest rate to 2.5% as it seeks to slow inflation in the eurozone. The US Federal Reserve, Bank of England and others all made similar moves this week.

title: US has huge lithium reserves, but concerns mount over mining
description: As President Joe Biden courts domestic lithium production for electric vehicle batteries, opposition by affected local communities grows against the impacts.

title: World Cup 2022: Qatar's defunct women's football team watches on with envy
description: They have not played a competitive match since 2014. However, those involved hope Morocco's success in male and female football can be expected to inspire Arab states to do more with the women's game.

title: World Cup: Moroccan dreams dashed but fans proud of underdog run
description: A semifinal defeat to France ended Morocco's stunning World Cup run. But fans from back home and abroad rallied around the underdogs that inspired a nation, region and continent.

title: World Cup: France down Morocco to keep title defense alive
description: Reigning world champions France ended Morocco's World Cup fairytale in the semifinals. Didier Deschamps' charges are now one game away from becoming only the third side ever to defend the World Cup title.

title: Morocco powering ahead of other African states on renewables
description: Morocco is scoring big on renewables projects. DW takes a look at how it got there.

title: German judiciary and the far-right
description: A Berlin judge was among the far-right extremists — so-called Reichsbürger — arrested for plotting to overthrow the government. She is not the only far-right member of the German justice system.

title: Snow covers Germany amid gas crunch
description: As Germany experienced its coldest December in a decade, the government implored residents to exercise restraint on turning up the heat.

title: German idioms made in heaven
description: Why would heaven hang full of violins? Discover German-language expressions relating to the heavenly spheres.

title: French companies seek role in Ukraine's reconstruction
description: French companies have gathered in Paris to talk about Ukraine's reconstruction efforts during and after the war. But another country could take center stage during the rebuilding phase.

title: 'Complete' Roman-era cemetery discovered in Gaza Strip
description: A 2,000-year-old Roman cemetery and necropolis containing up to 80 tombs was unearthed during housing construction in the northern Gaza Strip.

title: German economy will do better than expected, researchers say
description: Germany is set to enter a recession next year, but it will be milder than previously projected, leading economists say. Inflation and gas prices continued to fall.

title: Opinion: Why Morocco's Atlas Lions are Africa's pride
description: An impenetrable defense, pace on the counter and diaspora talent, yet still not everyone considers Morocco to be an African team. DW's Cai Nebe is from Namibia and explains why African fans should back the Atlas Lions.

title: Explaining the 'unexplained' gender pay gap
description: A team of researchers from 15 different countries has completed a major new study on the gender pay gap. It upends previous research that suggested the gap was caused by the types of jobs men and women ended up in.

title: CO2 tax at Europe's border: A revolution for the climate?
description: The EU is picking up speed with climate protection regulations. For imports from abroad, a carbon tariff will soon be introduced. But poorer countries could be unfairly disadvantaged by this.

title: DW's Christmas quiz
description: How familiar are you with German Christmas traditions? Take our quiz to find out!

title: Messi and Alvarez send Argentina to World Cup final
description: Lionel Messi can end doubts about the greatest player ever if he finally bags a winner's medal in Sunday's final, with Luka Modric's Croatia out of luck. Julian Alvarez also wowed the thunderous Argentina support.

title: Energy breakthrough: Can nuclear fusion help fuel the world?
description: On Tuesday, the US Department of Energy announced a breakthrough in the generation of energy using nuclear fusion. Here's what you need to know about how it works.

title: World Cup 2022: Morocco and Algeria — 'Forever brothers'
description: Despite ongoing diplomatic disputes, many Algerians are supporting their Moroccan neighbors in Qatar. The Atlas Lions are representing both Africa and the Arab world, but the identity of their opponents is also key.

title: Opinion: New German football task force lacks ideas
description: The German FA (DFB) announced that a new advisory task force will help get Hansi Flick and Germany back on track ahead of Euro 2024. DW's Jonathan Harding believes the group lacks innovative ideas.

title: Germany's far-right AfD and the 'Reichsbürger' movement
description: After a raid on members of a plot to violently overthrow the German state, questions are being asked about the links between the "Reichsbürger" movement the plotters belonged to, and the far-right populist AfD.

title: The sound of water in classical music
description: In this episode of DW Festival Concert, we take you to Herne in western Germany, for a festival that focuses on how 18th-century composers tried to capture the sound of water in their music.

title: German police launch raids against Last Generation activists
description: The raids have targeted the Last Generation group of climate activists, which recently grabbed headlines by blocking runways and vandalizing museums.

title: German railway firm ushers in new era for hydrogen trains
description: A railway company from the northern German town of Bremervörde has become the first in the world to operate a fleet of hydrogen trains in regular operation. Will it be the first of many around the globe?

title: Composer Angelo Badalamenti dies aged 85
description: Best-known for his musical scores for David Lynch films including "Blue Velvet" and the series "Twin Peaks," the Grammy-award winning composer died in his New Jersey home on Sunday.

title: KSK: German army elite force has a history of links to the far-right
description: A member of the German army's elite force, KSK, was among the far-right plotters who were arrested last week for planning to overthrow the government. DW takes a closer look at the KSK's tainted record.

title: What are keystone species and why do we need them?
description: From wolves to elephants to green moss, keystone animal and plant species are vital facilitators of healthy and biodiverse ecosystems.

title: Germany: Reichsbürger conspirators planned new army for coup
description: Germany's Bundestag held sessions to debate investigation into a coup, planned by far-right extremists. Prosecutors said the suspects planned to set up 280 armed units across Germany to facilitate the plot.

title: Wirecard: Defense slams key witness as 'main perpetrator'
description: The defense team for Wirecard's ex-boss called the charges against him "absurd." The company's collapse in 2020 dealt a blow to Germany's business reputation and raised accusations of improper government oversight.

title: Why do many people still believe in witches?
description: A global study shows that the belief in witchcraft is still alive and well in the 21st century.

title: Banksy: Street artist sells prints for Ukraine
description: British street artist Banksy is selling 50 art prints featuring a rat on a cardboard box, with all proceeds supporting civilians impacted by the war in Ukraine.

title: Bad diet causes cognitive decline: Fact or myth?
description: Studies suggest ultra-processed foods cause cognitive decline, but how strong is the evidence?

title: Europe's ski industry aims to save during the energy crisis
description: Slower cable cars and less heating are some of the ways ski resorts in Austria and Germany are adapting to the energy crisis. Higher costs also mean higher prices.

title: What next for China's economy as COVID curbs eased?
description: While stock markets rallied when Beijing relaxed virus restrictions, many experts think the recovery will be delayed. Between now and then, more trouble is likely for global supply chains and fresh inflation risks.

title: Human activity 'decimating' marine life — IUCN
description: Global conservation body, the IUCN, says there is a "perfect storm" of human activity which is "decimating marine species" in its latest updated list of threatened species.

title: Hallucinations are more common than you think
description: Theories suggest hallucinations are part of normal sensory perception, not just the result of mental disorders or drugs.

title: Sandra Mujinga, the artist who 'builds her skin with rocks'
description: Following her exhibition at the Venice Biennale, Sandra Mujinga now opens a large solo show in Berlin. In her works, the rising star of the art world deals with racism and our relationship with the environment.

title: What you need to know about stiff person syndrome (SPS)
description: Celine Dion revealed she is living with a rare condition called stiff person syndrome. Here’s what we know about the neurological disorder.

title: 'Elden Ring,' 'God of War Ragnarök': Best games of 2022
description: "Elden Ring," which has a plot by "Game of Thrones" writer George R. R. Martin, is one of the most popular games on the market. Here are the other winners of the Game Awards, where the "Hades II" trailer launched.

title: China completes delivery of first homegrown passenger jet
description: Beijing's dream for its own commercial aircraft production has taken the next important step. The delivery of the first C919 that is reportedly set to fly between Shanghai and Beijing starting next year.

title: US seeks to stop Microsoft's bid for 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard
description: The US Federal Trade Commission said Microsoft's $69 billion buyout of gaming giant Activision Blizzard, maker of the blockbuster "Call of Duty" title, would stifle competition.

title: Netflix 'Ancient Apocalypse' series marks dangerous trend, experts say
description: A popular new show on Netflix claims that survivors of an ancient civilization spread their wisdom to hunter-gatherers across the globe. Scientists say the show is promoting unfounded conspiracy theories.

title: No, Santa doesn't need to fly at the speed of light to visit all children!
description: Imagine you are Santa on Christmas Eve. What feat of physics will it take to deliver presents to millions of children across the world in one night?

title: German supply chain law gives human rights a voice
description: From next year, a new German law will force companies to ensure human rights compliance in their supply chains. Some firms are fearful, but others have started early and say there's nothing to worry about.

title: Why is it so important to protect nature and biodiversity?
description: Delegates from nearly 200 countries are in Montreal to find a way to protect the world's nature. But what's at risk when ecosystems are lost, and animals and plants go extinct?

title: UK approves controversial new coal mine, sparking criticism
description: The Woodhouse Colliery project is expected to take two years to build and create 500 jobs. However, many say it will set back Britain in its bid to meet climate goals.

title: Wirecard: trial against fraudulent fintech star kicks off in Germany
description: More than two years after the collapse of the digital payments firm Wirecard, ex-CEO Markus Braun and two managers are now on trial in Munich. DW recaps how Germany's worst post-war fraud scandal unfolded.

title: Trump Organization guilty in tax fraud trial, jury finds
description: Donald Trump's company has been accused of helping executives dodge personal income taxes on perks including Manhattan apartments and luxury cars.

title: Urgent UN talks hope to protect nature, halt rapid decline
description: A commitment to protect 30% of the world's land and ocean — and stave off mass extinction and climate change — will drive UN biodiversity conference talks in Montreal this week.

title: US sees 'momentum' in EU talks amid tensions over subsidies
description: Massive US subsidies for American companies have sparked concerns in Europe, as the EU views them as anti-competitive. While their talks reached no breakthrough, the two sides said they would intensify discussions.

title: How to protect soil from future drought and heat waves
description: Healthy soil is critical for global food security as well as the thousands of species that call it home. On World Soil Day, DW looks at what can be done to protect soil in the face of drought and intensifying heat.

title: Will EU oil embargo really hurt Russian war machine?
description: The EU has stopped buying Russian seaborne crude oil as it seeks to deprive Moscow of a key revenue source fueling its war in Ukraine. The move will hurt Russia but not as much as the bloc would have liked.

title: Is China headed for COVID-19 disaster?
description: If the harsh lockdowns currently in place end, experts warn China could be facing severe COVID-19 outbreaks due to low vaccine uptake and poor natural immunity in the population.

title: Indigenous Australians win legal fight against gas project
description: Tiwi people argued they should have been consulted before a massive gas drilling project started near their island, the Federal Court of Australia ruled. The ruling could slow other offshore projects.

title: Opinion: How to count your blessings
description: As a species, we are obsessed with counting. From steps and calories to social media followers and even blessings, the impulse appears to be hard-wired. But what about measuring the roads not taken?

title: Prince William set to award 2022 Earthshot Prize
description: A greenhouse in a box and a kelp forest restoration project are just two contenders in this year’s Earthshot environmental prize in Boston. Prince William will award five groups £1 million each to expand their projects.

title: India launches pilot digital currency project
description: India's central bank hopes a digital rupee will facilitate cheaper and easier financial transactions, as well as protect people from the volatility of private cryptocurrencies.

title: Volcanoes: Creators and destroyers of life
description: Volcanoes have both created and destroyed life on Earth. Now, scientists are studying volcanic eruptions, such as that of Mauna Loa in Hawaii, to predict the future of our planet.

title: US job cuts leave Asian tech workers in limbo
description: As US tech companies shed thousands of workers, those coming from abroad are being disproportionately affected by the job cuts. Asian IT specialists are in the US mostly on work visas, and are now falling off a cliff.

title: Defending the environment can be a death sentence
description: More than 1,700 environmental and land defenders have been killed in the last decade. Most of them were Indigenous people — and most were in Latin America, a DW analysis shows.

title: Is lecanemab really a breakthrough drug for Alzheimer's?
description: Lecanemab appeared to slow progression of the disease in a phase three Alzheimer's drug trial. But is the drug as effective as hoped?

title: Swiss 'water battery' boosts Europe's energy storage plans
description: A Swiss company has built what is being called a giant water battery deep under the Alps that provides an energy storage capacity equivalent to 400,000 electric car batteries. It could be a game changer.

title: How is AI helping FIFA detect offsides?
description: New artificial intelligence can detect offsides much faster than past technology, which took over a minute on average.

title: Freezing to death: What happens in the body?
description: Winter has arrived in Ukraine, amplifying fears of the cold amid a war causing frequent energy blackouts. Here’s what happens in the body when it freezes to death.

title: US cracks down on methane pollution
description: The US has put forward draft rules that would cut emissions of natural gas. It's part of a broader global push to limit the powerful planet-heating gas. But experts say it still may not be enough.

title: Mauna Loa: World's largest active volcano erupts in Hawaii
description: Authorities say flows of lava are not yet threatening local communities, but that it is impossible to predict how long the volcano's first eruption in four decades would last.

title: Talks begin on global treaty to curb plastic pollution
description: Negotiators are meeting this week to start hammering out the details of a global agreement on plastic pollution. What's on the table?

title: Global trade rules against extinction: Do they work?
description: One million animal and plant species are critically endangered. An international convention is supposed to stop using trade restrictions.

title: Why are more and more girls starting puberty early?
description: More children have been starting puberty abnormally early since the start of the COVID pandemic. Where does this change come from?

title: German Africa Prize 2022 awarded to African corona scientists
description: German Chancellor Scholz is set to award Sikhulile Moyo und Tulio de Oliveira the German Africa Prize this Friday. The two discovered the Omicron coronavirus variant, an achievement for which they also received threats.

title: The environmental impact of Black Friday
description: It's that time of year again: the pre-Christmas consumer frenzy also known as Black Friday. During the biggest shopping event of the year, retailers slash their prices. But what does that mean for the environment?

title: Does it make sense to switch to heat pumps in older buildings?
description: Driven by the energy crisis, demand for heat pumps is on the rise — even for older houses and buildings. Here's a breakdown of whether it makes sense to switch.

title: Energy crisis: France bets on floating offshore wind energy
description: France has become the first country to tender out industrial-size floating offshore wind farms. The floating platforms are more promising than existing renewables but still have some hurdles to overcome.

title: Zaporizhzhia: What would happen if there was an accident?
description: Although it's impossible to say for sure what consequences an accident at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant might have on human health in the environment nearby, experts can make some predictions.

title: Frets over hearing loss from loud music falling on deaf ears
description: Twenty-four percent of young adults listen to music at unsafe levels, a new study shows, putting 1 billion people at risk of hearing problems worldwide. How can you protect your hearing?

title: Putin Visits Belarus, Stirring New Concern on Future of Ukraine War
description: Belarus has resisted being drawn more centrally into the war. But the visit raised worries that a new Russian ground offensive could aim again at Kyiv, near the Belarusian border.

title: From Zero Covid to No Plan: Behind China’s Pandemic U-Turn
description: After micromanaging the coronavirus strategy for nearly three years, the country’s leader, Xi Jinping, has suddenly left the populace to improvise.

title: As Peru’s Unrest Chases Away Visitors, Many Fear for Their Livelihood
description: In Cusco, the gateway to Machu Picchu and other ancient sites, tourist operators and hotel owners fear what the loss of visitors means for their livelihood.

title: South Africa’s President, Cyril Ramaphosa, Wins Battle to Lead A.N.C.
description: Despite a high-profile scandal, Cyril Ramaphosa consolidated support from the party that has dominated South Africa since independence. But with misery rising, can the A.N.C. retain its hold?

title: Putin Discusses ‘Unified’ Defense With Belarus During Visit to Its Capital
description: The Russian president said he and his Belarusian counterpart talked about a “unified defensive space.” Ukraine has warned that Russian forces could be preparing a new offensive from Belarus.

title: 5 Killed in Shooting at Canadian Condo Building, Police Say
description: The 73-year-old gunman, who was fatally shot by the police at a high-rise building in Vaughan, Ontario, had been in a long-running feud with the condo board.

title: After 90 Years, a Menorah That Symbolized Defiance Is Rekindled in Germany
description: A 1931 photograph of a menorah on a windowsill also showed a Nazi flag in the street outside. This Hanukkah the menorah returned to Germany.

title: Mark Rutte Apologizes for Netherlands’ Role in Slave Trade
description: People were “exploited and abused in the name of the Dutch state,” Mark Rutte said, but some descendants of enslaved people say the government did not involve them in the apology.

title: Pope Francis to Return 3 Parthenon Marble Fragments to Greece
description: The pope will donate the 2,500-year-old pieces held by the Vatican Museums to the archbishop of Athens, a gesture that increases pressure on the British Museum to act over similar items on show in London.

title: What a Discovery of Old Negatives Revealed About Zaharia Cușnir
description: For Zaharia Cusnir, photography was an all-consuming passion. Now, nearly 30 years after he died in obscurity, the Moldovan’s fame is rising.

title: UK High Court Rules on Rwanda  Deportation Plan
description: The highly criticized effort is meant to deter those crossing the English Channel in small boats, but experts say that it would violate international law.

title: King Charles III Is the New Face of U.K. Money
description: Pound notes with the new sovereign’s image will begin appearing in 2024, though money with his mother’s likeness will still be in circulation.

title: Royal Thai Navy Scrambles to Rescue 31 After Its Ship Sinks
description: Officials said the HTMS Sukhothai took on water, lost power and eventually sank in the Gulf of Thailand overnight.

title: Jose Maria Sison, Philippine Communist Party Founder, Dies at 83
description: Fielding a force of armed guerrillas, the organization had a role in the ouster of Ferdinand Marcos. In exile he continued, in his words, to “lead from abroad.”

title: US Cybermilitary Force Details Its Support for Ukraine’s Digital Defense
description: Russia has struggled to see military gains from its cyberattacks in the world’s first sustained cyberspace battle between two sophisticated militaries.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Jan. 6 Panel Refers Trump for Charges
description: Plus: Elon Musk asks Twitter users if he should resign.

title: COP15 Biodiversity Talks: Countries Sign On to “30x30” Conservation Plan
description: Roughly 190 nations, aiming to halt a dangerous decline in biodiversity, agreed to preserve 30 percent of the planet’s land and seas. The United States is not officially a participant.

title: Publishing, Under Pressure
description: The books business has had a difficult year.

title: The Austere Beauty of Egypt’s Long-Distance Hiking Trails
description: Two new routes, managed by Bedouins, will help preserve long-overlooked natural wonders and a vanishing way of life.

title: Ukraine Selects Its Entry for Eurovision Song Contest
description: The electronic music duo Tvorchi won with the song “Heart of Steel,” which the singers said was inspired by the courage of Ukrainian soldiers defending Mariupol.

title: Seeking Heat, and Companionship, in a Hard Scotland Winter
description: In a Glasgow neighborhood, the cost-of-living crisis is exacerbating energy problems and financial worries, and vital community hubs are struggling to stay afloat.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: A World Cup final for the ages.

title: Putin’s visit signals pressure is mounting on Belarus’s leader to expand support for Russia’s war.
Drone Attacks Target Kyiv and Two Other Ukrainian Regions
description: Ukraine said that it had shot down 20 of 35 drones that Russia had launched, though those that evaded air defenses had hit power plants, electrical systems and other civilian targets.

title: In Heart of Peru’s Protest, a Pause to Mourn the Dead
description: Confrontations between protesters and the Peruvian authorities have left at least 25 dead and hundreds injured. Nowhere may tensions be higher than in the highland city of Ayacucho.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Argentina Triumphs
description: Plus: A Times analysis of how Russia bungled the invasion.

title: Ukraine Says Russia May Be Planning Winter Offensive
description: An adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky urged Western allies to take seriously the threat of a new Russian onslaught, which could include mass infantry attacks.

title: UK Moves to Eliminate Some Liquid and Laptop Airport Security Rules
description: New technology could clear a path for relaxed security checks at airports by June 2024.

title: What Russia Got Wrong
description: A cascade of military failures started with Vladimir Putin.

title: Counting Russia’s War Dead in Ukraine
description: Amid doubts about Moscow’s true war losses, Russian data journalists and volunteers use news articles, tombstone photographs and other open-source information to tally the Russian toll from the war in Ukraine.

title: Local News Outlet in New York Faces New Hurdle: A Declined Visa
description: Phil O’Brien, a Briton who has run a Manhattan publication for several years, had his visa denied because immigration officials deemed his struggling business “marginal.”

title: How Can Tainted Spinach Cause Hallucinations?
description: A food recall from Australia sheds light on an unusual aspect of brain chemistry.

title: South Korea Accuses the North of Launching Missiles. The North Says It Was a Satellite Test.
description: The North has made similar claims before when it was in fact preparing for ICBM launches.

title: India’s Urdu Poetry Festival Draws Stadium Crowds
description: That 300,000 people celebrated Urdu verse during a three-day festival was testament to the peculiar reality of the language in India.

title: Military Spending Surges, Creating New Boom for Arms Makers
description: The combination of the war in Ukraine and concern about longer-term threats from Russia and China is driving a bipartisan push to increase U.S. capacity to produce weapons.

title: Taraneh Alidoosti, Iranian Actress, Arrested After Voicing Support for Protests
description: The actress, Taraneh Alidoosti, had urged people to speak out after the execution of a man involved in nationwide demonstrations.

title: Behind Argentina’s World Cup Magic, an Army of Witches
description: France might have its star Kylian Mbappé, but Argentina has hundreds of “brujas” casting spells to protect Lionel Messi and the rest of its national squad.

title: Putin Visits Ukraine War Headquarters
description: The meetings with his top brass seemed to signal a shift from his largely hands-off public posture to one conveying a more active role in war planning.

title: Ukrainians Focus on Resilience a Day After Major Russian Strikes
description: The mayor of Kyiv said that water was back on and that the city’s subway service had resumed. President Volodymyr Zelensky urged businesses to help set up more “invincibility centers” for the public.

title: The Best of 2022
description: It’s best-of season. Let’s dig in.

title: Revisiting an Anti-Immigrant Quebec Town Uncovers a Plot Twist
description: Norimitsu Onishi, a New York Times reporter, traveled to Hérouxville, Quebec, to learn what had happened in the 15 years since the town passed its xenophobic immigration code.

title: World Cup Final Caps a Complex Saga Between Messi and Argentina
description: Lionel Messi left Argentina when he was 13 and has had a complicated relationship with the nation since. But this World Cup has changed things.

title: How the Xenophobic Town of Hérouxville, Quebec, Fell in Love With Immigrants
description: “We now want as many immigrants as possible,” said Bernard Thompson, the mayor of Hérouxville, Quebec, a onetime supporter of the town’s anti-immigrant code.

title: When Did the Anthropocene Start? Scientists Closer to Saying When.
description: A panel of experts has spent more than a decade deliberating on how, and whether, to mark a momentous new epoch in geologic time: our own.

title: Eight Takeaways From The Times’s Investigation Into Putin’s War in Ukraine
description: Secret Russian battle plans, intercepts, and interviews with Russian soldiers and Kremlin confidants revealed new details of how Vladimir Putin botched his invasion of Ukraine.

title: Leo Varadkar, Ireland’s Returning Leader, Has Lots to Prove
description: In Leo Varadkar’s first stint as prime minister, he embodied for many his country’s move into modernity. But after several missteps, he now takes up the role for a second time, with the glow of optimism dimmed.

title: Tunisia Heads for First Elections Since Presidential Power Grab
description: Voters will choose a new Parliament, but under revised rules that vastly dilute the influence of political parties that many blame for sabotaging the North African nation’s 10-year experiment with democracy.

title: J. Robert Oppenheimer Cleared of ‘Black Mark’ After 68 Years
description: The physicist and architect of the American atomic bomb was stripped of his security clearance in 1954 after what is now called a flawed investigation.

title: New Covid Booster Shots Cut Risk of Hospitalization by Half, CDC Reports
description: The research was conducted in part when older variants of the coronavirus were spreading. Other factors may have influenced the conclusions.

title: Death Toll in Peru Protests Rises as New Leader Struggles for Control
description: Two government ministers resigned after the new president, Dina Boluarte, deployed the military to crack down on the demonstrations that have convulsed the country.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Waves of Missiles, Knocking Out Heat and Power
description: Dozens of missiles knocked out heat and electricity systems around the country including in Kyiv, where two-thirds of its residents had no heat or water.

title: Peru Protest Photos
description: The unrest started after the ouster of President Pedro Castillo, who tried to dissolve Congress and was arrested.

title: Russian Official in Africa Wounded by Package Bomb, Moscow Says
description: The official, previously identified as a senior operative with the Wagner Group, was hospitalized in the capital of the Central African Republic, according to the Russian embassy.

title: Leaders Mix Sports and Diplomacy at the World Cup
description: Dozens of top officials have flown to Qatar to cheer for teams while talking shop. The event has magnified the tiny Gulf nation’s role as a diplomatic broker.

title: Joe Kennedy III to be Named Envoy to Northern Ireland
description: With the appointment of Joe Kennedy III, President Biden hopes a marquee name will aid in promoting economic development in the struggling country.

title: Former Palace Aide Makes Face-Face Apology to Ngozi Fulani Over Remarks
description: Ngozi Fulani, who runs a charity for abused women, said a palace aide, Susan Hussey, pressed her on where she was from, dismissing Britain as an answer. Ms. Hussey resigned over the episode.

title: Crucial Talks on Preserving Nature Are on Now. Here Are the Key Issues.
description: Negotiators from around the world are meeting in Canada in an effort to halt, and reverse, staggering declines in wildlife.

title: Bad Bunny’s Concert in Mexico Sold Out, But Many Ticket Holders Were Turned Away
description: The concert was supposed to be one of Mexico’s largest, sold out months before. Instead, one of the world’s biggest stars played to a half empty floor.

title: Israel’s Arab Allies Signal Business as Usual, Despite Far Right’s Rise
description: Benjamin Netanyahu is close to forming a coalition with Israel’s far right and the Arab states that normalized ties in 2020 appear unconcerned.
